title: World War II Valor in the Pacific National Monument: Learn About the Park
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park           Learn About the Park               News at the Monument   Here you'll find our press releases, press kit, social media links, and more.         Photos and Multimedia   Haven't made it to Hawaii yet? Experience the monument from afar! Here you'll find photos, videos, audio, and other multimedia.        History and Culture   Learn about the people and places that make up the story of the attack on Pearl Harbor on Dec. 7th, 1941.                    Plants and Animals   Learn about Hawaiian plants and animals, many of which are endemic to Hawaii, meaning they are found nowhere else on earth!        Science and Research   The monument is a hub for science & research relating to underwater archaeology, coral ecology, artifact preservation, and advanced imaging.        Education   WWII Valor in the Pacific National Monument is an educational and community resource for kids and adults, in Hawaii and beyond.                    Kids and Youth   Learn about the programs that WWII Valor in the Pacific National Monument has for kids, including our Jr. Ranger Program and special events!        Management   Find out who keeps daily operations going here at WWII Valor in the Pacific National Monument.        About the Monument   Learn about WWII Valor in the Pacific National Monument, including the monument's purpose, significance, and interpretive themes.
